title: Fragment of a public inscription
support: Fragment of a fine white limestone, broken on all sides, seemingly including the rear also (so not preserving original thickness); presumably part of a plaque or stele.

layout.p: Letters preserved from three lines of text, damaged on all sides, with a vacat of 2.3 cm between lines 2 and 3.

handNote.lettering: Smaller letters than in the other similar fragments from Halaesa, with faint traces of serifs (but the surface is very worn). The interaxial measurement between omicron and nu is 9-10 mm. The letter forms are comparable however to other fragmentary texts of the later C2 / early C1 BCE from Halaesa.

date._: Later 2nd century BCE or early C1 BCE

provenanceFound._: Casual surface find, 2001-2002, along the track which runs from the church of S. maria towards the agora, between insulae VI and VII to the west of the 'cardo massimo'.

provenanceObserved._: In the archaeological stores of the Soprintendenza di Messina

facsimile.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

repository._: Soprintendenza Beni Culturali e Ambientali di Messina

museum.name: Soprintendenza Beni Culturali e Ambientali di Messina
museum.description: Offices and stores of the provincial archaeological authority

bibl.author: Arena
bibl.title: Nuove epigrafi greche da Halaesa Archonidea. Dati inediti sulle Tabulae Halaesinae e su una città della Sicilia tardo-ellenistica
